greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number of distinct primes = 1 mod 4 dividing n.
link: Reinhard Zumkeller, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
Étienne Fouvry and Peter Koymans, On Dirichlet biquadratic fields, arXiv:2001.05350 [math.NT], 2020.
formula: Additive with a(p^e) = 1 if p = 1 (mod 4), 0 otherwise.
mathematica: a[n_] := DivisorSum[n, Boole[PrimeQ[#] && Mod[#, 4] == 1]&]; Array[a, 100] (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Dec 01 2015 *)
program: (MAGMA) [#[p:p in PrimeDivisors(n)|p mod 4 eq 1]: n in [1..100]]; // _Marius A. Burtea_, Jan 16 2020
results.author: _N. J. A. Sloane_.
